intro: Matelea torulosa, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, emitting a strong, sweet fragrance. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is known for its velvety, hairy leaves and stems. Its flowers typically bloom during the summer months and are pollinated by nocturnal insects such as moths. Matelea torulosa is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions.
